se.jguru.nazgul.tools.codestyle.enforcer.rules

Enum ProjectType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ProjectType>
      • se.jguru.nazgul.tools.codestyle.enforcer.rules.ProjectType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<ProjectType>

    public enum ProjectType
extends Enum<ProjectType>
    Definition of project types, including pattern matching for recognition.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      API
      API project, defining service interaction, abstract implementations and exceptions.
      ASPECT
      Aspect definition project, holding publicly available aspects.
      ASSEMBLY
      Pom project, defining assemblies and/or aggregation projects.
      CODESTYLE
      Codestyle helper project, providing implementations for use within the build definition cycle.
      EXAMPLE
      Example project providing runnable example code for showing the typical scenarios of the component.
      IMPLEMENTATION
      Implementation project, implementing service interactions from an API or SPI project, including dependencies on 3rd party libraries.
      INTEGRATION_TEST
      Integration test artifact helper project, used to perform automated tests for several projects.
      JAVA_AGENT
      javaagent definition project, holding implementation of a JVM agent to be launched in-process on the form -javaagent:[yourpath/][agentjar].jar=[option1]=[value1],[option2]=[value2] This project type can import/inject implementation dependencies, as it is considered an application entrypoint.
      JEE_APPLICATION
      Application project defining JEE-deployable artifacts.
      MODEL
      Model project defining entities.
      PARENT
      Parent pom project, of type pom, defining dependencies and/or build life cycles.
      PLUGIN
      Project, defining a Maven plugin.
      PROOF_OF_CONCEPT
      Proof-of-concept helper project, holding proof of concept implementations.
      REACTOR
      Reactor project, of type pom.
      SPI
      SPI project, defining service interaction, abstract implementations and exceptions.
      STANDALONE_APPLICATION
      Standalone application project defining runnable Java applications.
      TEST
      Test artifact helper project, implementing libraries facilitating testing within other projects.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • REACTOR

        public static final ProjectType REACTOR

        Reactor project, of type pom. May not contain anything except module definitions.

      • PARENT

        public static final ProjectType PARENT

        Parent pom project, of type pom, defining dependencies and/or build life cycles. May not contain module definitions.

      • ASSEMBLY

        public static final ProjectType ASSEMBLY

        Pom project, defining assemblies and/or aggregation projects. May not contain module definitions.

      • ASPECT

        public static final ProjectType ASPECT
        Aspect definition project, holding publicly available aspects.

      • MODEL

        public static final ProjectType MODEL

        Model project defining entities. May have test-scope dependencies on test and proof-of-concept projects.

      • JEE_APPLICATION

        public static final ProjectType JEE_APPLICATION
        Application project defining JEE-deployable artifacts. Injections of implementation projects are permitted here.

      • STANDALONE_APPLICATION

        public static final ProjectType STANDALONE_APPLICATION
        Standalone application project defining runnable Java applications. Injections of implementation projects are permitted here.

      • EXAMPLE

        public static final ProjectType EXAMPLE

        Example project providing runnable example code for showing the typical scenarios of the component. Should contain relevant documentation as well as cut-and-paste code. No dependency rules.

      • JAVA_AGENT

        public static final ProjectType JAVA_AGENT

        javaagent definition project, holding implementation of a JVM agent to be launched in-process on the form -javaagent:[yourpath/][agentjar].jar=[option1]=[value1],[option2]=[value2]

        This project type can import/inject implementation dependencies, as it is considered an application entrypoint.

      • API

        public static final ProjectType API

        API project, defining service interaction, abstract implementations and exceptions. May have compile-scope dependencies on model projects within the same component, and test-scope dependencies on test and proof-of-concept projects.

      • SPI

        public static final ProjectType SPI

        SPI project, defining service interaction, abstract implementations and exceptions. Must have compile-scope dependencies to API projects within the same component. May have test-scope dependencies on test and proof-of-concept projects.

      • IMPLEMENTATION

        public static final ProjectType IMPLEMENTATION

        Implementation project, implementing service interactions from an API or SPI project, including dependencies on 3rd party libraries. Must have compile-scope dependencies to API or SPI projects within the same component. May have test-scope dependencies on test and proof-of-concept projects.

      • TEST

        public static final ProjectType TEST

        Test artifact helper project, implementing libraries facilitating testing within other projects. No dependency rules.

      • INTEGRATION_TEST

        public static final ProjectType INTEGRATION_TEST

        Integration test artifact helper project, used to perform automated tests for several projects. No dependency rules.

      • CODESTYLE

        public static final ProjectType CODESTYLE

        Codestyle helper project, providing implementations for use within the build definition cycle. Typically used within local reactors to supply changes or augmentations to build configurations such as checkstyle.xml, or custom enforcer rule implementations. No dependency rules.

      • PLUGIN

        public static final ProjectType PLUGIN
        Project, defining a Maven plugin.

      • PROOF_OF_CONCEPT

        public static final ProjectType PROOF_OF_CONCEPT

        Proof-of-concept helper project, holding proof of concept implementations. No dependency rules.

      • values

        public static ProjectType[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (ProjectType c : ProjectType.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static ProjectType valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • isCompliantArtifactID

        public boolean isCompliantArtifactID(String artifactID)
        Checks if the provided artifactID complies with the naming standard for this ProjectType.
        Parameters:
        artifactID - The artifactID which should be checked for compliance.
        Returns:
        true if the provided artifactID was compliant with the naming rules for this ProjectType.

      • isCompliantGroupID

        public boolean isCompliantGroupID(String groupID)
        Checks if the provided groupID complies with the naming standard for this ProjectType.
        Parameters:
        groupID - The groupID which should be checked for compliance.
        Returns:
        true if the provided groupID was compliant with the naming rules for this ProjectType. If no groupID pattern is given, true is returned.

      • isCompliantPackaging

        public boolean isCompliantPackaging(String packaging)
        Checks if the provided packaging complies with the standard/requirements of this ProjectType.
        Parameters:
        packaging - THe packaging which should be checked for compliance.
        Returns:
        true if the provided packaging was compliant with the rules for this ProjectType. If no packaging pattern was given, true is returned.

      • getProjectType

        public static ProjectType getProjectType(org.apache.maven.artifact.Artifact internalArtifact)
        Acquires the ProjectType instance for the provided internal Artifact, or throws an IllegalArgumentException holding an exception message if a ProjectType could not be found for the provided Artifact.
        Parameters:
        internalArtifact - The internally developed artifact
        Returns:
        The corresponding ProjectType.

      • getProjectType

        public static ProjectType getProjectType(org.apache.maven.project.MavenProject project)
                                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Acquires the ProjectType instance for the provided MavenProject, or throws an IllegalArgumentException holding an exception message if a ProjectType could not be found for the provided MavenProject.
        Parameters:
        project - The MavenProject to classify.
        Returns:
        The corresponding ProjectType.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given project could not be mapped to a [single] ProjectType. The exception message holds
